Title: Software Engineer in Test
Job description: You’ll work as part of a small QA team, and be integrated within a scrum team composed of product owners, developers, dev ops engineers and data scientists.
full-description:
Infogrid is helping protect the planet and improve the lives of billions of people by making every building a smart building.

Our goal is to be the global provider for connected devices in smart buildings. We already handle millions of events every day from tens of thousands of sensors and we’d like you to help us scale that by an order of magnitude over the coming months.

Sustainability is at our heart; buildings account for 39% of global carbon emissions and we’re creating real solutions to impact this!

We are still early in our journey but have already achieved a lot; we raised a successful series A funding round, grew 5x in employee numbers within 12 months, and voted one of the top 10 most flexible places to work.

Want to know more about how we're building Infogrid? Our CTO wrote a blog post about this.

What are we looking for?
Here at Infogrid, we love an automation first approach when it comes to QA, so at the forefront of what we’re looking for is an analytical approach that asks “how can we automate this?” rather than “how can we test this?”.

You’ll work as part of a small QA team, and be integrated within a scrum team composed of product owners, developers, dev ops engineers and data scientists.

Our QA’s tasks will involve adding to and maintaining a UI and API test automation suite in Cypress, writing and executing performance tests using Locust, as well as some manual testing effort where required.

Performance testing is a critical part of what we do here, so it's an essential requirement for us when looking at experience. We would also be looking for experience with setup and teardown of data within test runs.

The work will be challenging, but fun and full of variety; you’ll work at the cutting edge of IoT and will learn a huge amount. Most of all, we offer the opportunity to help shape the future of IoT globally.
We think Infogrid is a great place to work - we’re a recently funded and rapidly growing startup so it’s not perfect but:

❤️ Feel good about your work: Infogrid is actively helping big companies reduce their environmental footprint. We also offset everyone’s carbon footprint.
We’re flexible: We encourage remote working and offer flexible working hours before COVID and we’ll keep that flexibility afterward.
Learn and get promoted: Join us at the start of our journey - we’re growing quickly and believe in promoting from within. You can learn and grow your career here
Improve yourself: We give everyone a day per month to focus on personal development
‍‍ Make friends: Everyone here is lovely
Added bonus: We give everyone options in the company.
Join a legitimately secure tech start-up: $15.5M funding round is great of course but more importantly we have real paying customers and a good, growing revenue stream.

And we'll do everything we can to support you during your application. If you need us to make any adjustments to your recruitment process, speak to our recruitment team who will be happy to support you.

So that’s us. If you love the idea of building something great that makes the world a better place, in a slightly chaotic but consistently entertaining environment please do get in touch via the apply button.

Title: Site Reliability Engineer - Vice President
Job description:
Able to communicate effectively with developers, engineers and upper management.
As a Site Reliability Engineer (SRE), you'll help build a meaningful…
full-description:
As a Site Reliability Engineer (SRE), you'll help build a meaningful engineering discipline, combining software and systems to develop creative engineering solutions to operations problems. Much of our support and software development focuses on optimizing existing systems, building infrastructure, and reducing work through automation. You'll join a team of curious problem solvers with a diverse set of perspectives who are thinking big and taking risks. In this environment, you'll take the lead on relevant projects, supported by an organization that provides the support and mentorship you need to learn and grow. As an SRE, you'll be focused on running better production applications and systems.
Essential Duties/Responsibilities

Develop the reliability process to ensure the highest level of systems availability, stability, security and performance, including maintenance and support, root cause analysis, systems validation, performance tuning and capacity management.
Work closely with Engineering and Product teams to identify and implement solutions that meet production, development, and administrative needs in Linux-based environments
Drive technical innovation and efficiency in application and infrastructure operations via simplification and automation.
Coordinate between infrastructure, platform and application subject matter experts to promote reliability efforts through communication and best practice sharing.
Identify changes for the product architecture from the reliability, performance, and availability perspective with a data driven approach
Strong interest in SRE topics like SLOs, resilience, scaling, performance, automation and more
Own and suggest improvements to our deployment process and tools

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required
A self-starter who is willing to take a task from gathering requirements to deployment and maintenance
Proficient with configuration management and build tools
Experienced in writing/reading Bash , and Python code
Have championed new technologies/processes, and architected their design, implementation and delivery to production
Can implement and manage high-availability infrastructure solutions with automatic failover
Stay on top of current DevOps and infrastructure news
Able to work effectively and be pragmatic as part of a remote team in a dynamic business environment
Comfortable working independently and able to escalate problems when necessary
Can identify problem or opportunity areas, develop and implement fixes and changes as necessary
Able to communicate effectively with developers, engineers and upper management
Eager to learn; able to understand and apply new things relatively quickly
Willing to mentor and guide fellow team members effectively and constructively in a wide variety of disciplines, both technical and business-like in nature

Qualifications/Requirements:
Bachelor's degree and experience in application development and support for associated infrastructure (Linux Based)
Experience with continuous integration environments like Jenkins
Experience in designing, building, and troubleshooting large scale distributed systems
Systems engineering experience
Critical thinking, problem solving and creativity
Experience with Bash and Python Language
Strong interpersonal communication skills with ability to work well in diverse-team-oriented settings with other developers, Product Managers, other SREs, etc.
J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world's most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.
We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

full-description:
You will work closely with our other developers to help meet the day to day business needs of Echobox. This includes fixing technical problems, responding to customer questions and providing software development assistance to the Data Science team. As the technical team grows you should be strongly motivated to move into a Senior developer role.

Work with our other developers to help meet the day to day business needs of Echobox.
Be jointly responsible for the maintenance and quality of codebases and infrastructure.
Help transition prototypes developed by the Data Science team into highly available, scalable and performant end user products.
About Echobox:
We are a fast-growing, research-driven company building an artificial intelligence that helps online publishers overcome the challenges they face every day. Using novel machine learning techniques, we are revolutionising the publishing industry and have a track record of building things that others have ruled out as impossible. Leading names from around the world rely on our product every day, including The Times, Le Monde, The Guardian, Vogue and many more.
Our team is our best asset. We work with extremely smart and talented individuals, who all enjoy a high degree of responsibility and independence in structuring their work.
Do you think you have what it takes to be part of Echobox? We'd love to hear from you.

To get a better insight into the kind of work we do, check out our open-source project on Github (https://ebx.sh/gh), our data showcases (https://showcase.echobox.com) and our YouTube content on Microservices (https://ebx.sh/microservices).

DCVS

A familiarity with Java (SE8+) and a desire to become an expert
Experience developing software as part of a team, e.g. open source software projects.
NoSQL and RDBMS
An understanding of software security.
Benefits:
Our employees enjoy free breakfast every day, coffee, drinks and snacks all day, everyday.
Every Wednesday, we order food for our weekly team lunches where everyone gets together for an hour of fun.
We have monthly team events (dinner, bowling, karting, poker nights, board-games etc.) for our team to get to know each other outside of work.
Professionally, we host in-house conferences and an annual summer camp for all our global employees who are flown to and hosted in London.
We ensure that all our employees also get pension contributions, the latest tech, generous annual leave and an amazing office with a balcony overlooking Notting Hill.

Title: Graduate Software Engineer
Job description: In this exciting and varied role, you will help design, develop, and improve the company's industry leading software as well as review existing code, provide…
full-description:
Experts believe that the automotive industry is set to change more in the next 10 years than in the last 100. One key element to this is ecommerce. While many sectors have embraced it, due to the complexity of data and systems in the car buying process, joining up the dots to create a truly omnichannel experience - seamlessly connecting offline and online worlds - for car buyers has not been possible. Until now.

Leading automotive industry suppliers Autofutura and GForces have recently merged to create an ambitious new group. Together they provide the innovative tools, solutions, and services to connect car manufacturer, finance provider, dealer and consumer to streamline the entire customer journey and ultimately sell more cars, improve customer retention and create substantial efficiencies for their customers. In short, the new entity is the interface between its customers and car buyers, enabling scalable online transactions across multiple territories and markets, in one of the most exciting and fast-changing industries in the world.

The Role
In this exciting and varied role, you will help design, develop, and improve the company's industry leading software as well as review existing code, provide support and be an active member of an Agile product team.

The ideal candidate will be a Graduate in Computer Science or a related field and have experience with Python and/or Typescript. They will be looking for a long-term career where they can progress technically through specialist training and support from the wider team and department.

This is a fantastic opportunity to join an expanding team, offering the ability to gain experience contributing to, and evolving commercial software ranging from CMS platforms, CRM systems, inventory management systems, and ecommerce platforms.

Key Responsibilities
Designing and developing platform improvements in line with the business vision and technical strategy.
Analyse and improve efficiency, scalability and stability of products and services.
Contribute to building a culture of support, creativity and learning within your Agile product team and the wider Development department.

Essential Skills
Degree in Computer Science or in a related field
Experience of Typescript and/or Python
Familiar with API principles (REST, GraphQL)
Looking for a long-term career where the candidate can progress technically and improve their skills

Salary
From £22,500 per annum

Location
Maidstone, Kent / Remote

Department
Production – Development

Position Reports To
Lead Software Engineer

Benefits
25 days holiday plus birthday off
Up to 5 additional days holiday for long service
GForces group pension plan
Enhanced maternity and paternity
Regular socials and company events
Flexible hours

Under the Equality Act 2010, we aim to be an equal opportunities employer and we are determined to ensure that no applicant or employee receives less favourable treatment on the grounds of gender, age, disability, religion, belief, sexual orientation, marital status, or race, or is disadvantaged by conditions or requirements which cannot be shown to be justifiable.

Title: Software Engineer
Job description:
Understanding of different deployment models for server-side software.
Proactive use of test and deployment automation to assure quality of delivered software.
full-description:
LexisNexis UK are looking for a highly motivated C# (.Net) Software Engineer to aid in the scaling and transformation of the UK technology organization. The role will help modernize the technology landscape and drive the usage of industry recognized best practices across the engineering functions.
You will be a key instigator and model citizen in establishing an Agile, value driven culture and ensuring we are building high quality products that the business is proud of. Reporting into a Software Engineering Manager, you will be a pivotal member of the UK technology team, working with the business to perform complex research, design, and software development assignments.
Tax Technology Team
Tax technology are a small and very diverse team of around 16 people, delivering the next generation of Tolley Guidance and Tolley Library products. The team has had very low attrition since its inception a few years ago, and we’re recruiting mostly due to expansion. This isn’t just your next job, it’s a real career path with excellent prospects in a very democratic team where most decisions are made by the developers rather than decided by management.
We’re a product led team focusing on the Tolley products within LexisNexis, that puts Agile at the core of everything we do, and we constantly iterate on our ways of working & technology platforms to improve our delivery and our products. We practice CI/CD, TDD, TBD, which we deliver through pair programming to keep our production code constantly up to date and of a high quality. We’ll aim to get you coding on day one and probably in production before the end of your first day. The team are friendly, supportive, highly motivated and always keen to learn new technologies and ways of working.
We’re looking for someone who wants to get things done, learn new things, and who wants to be a better developer tomorrow than they are today. The skills and technologies required below are a reflection of what we do today and will evolve over time. We’re not expecting you to have mastered each of these before applying – what you don’t know we can help you learn, and there is nobody in the team that has mastered all of what we use today. We take training and continuous personal development very seriously and make provision of time and resources to develop our skillsets.
We actively discourage a long hours culture, and can provide flexibility in working arrangements to suit most needs. At the time of writing we’re working from home, with a plan to return to the office when safe to do so on Thursdays plus one other day decided by the individual, however, this will be an experiment and is open to change at a corporate level, meaning the number of working from office days may change in future.
Role Requirements:
Candidates preferred with the following technical experience:
Demonstrate experience working in C# (.Net) environment
Good understanding of Javascript Frameworks either TypeScript, Angular, React or Vue
Understanding of Microservices (RESTful APIs)
Agile or Waterfall Software Development lifecycle experience
Knowledge of AWS (EC2, Lambda, Cognito, Route53, CloudFormation)
Worked with a range of data store technologies (relational and NoSQL)
Experience in ways of working (TDD, BDD etc)
Help guide more junior members of staff from a technical perspective
·Proactive use of test and deployment automation to assure quality of delivered software
Engaging with product managers and wider stakeholders to ensure developing things of value for customers and business
Consistent use of good Coding Standards and driven to improve personal code quality as well as a willingness and practice of embedding the standards with more junior developers.
A Good understanding of SOLID and its impact on testability
Nice to haves
Proactive use of test and deployment automation to assure quality of delivered software
An understanding of secure computing (OWASP top 10 etc) and defensive coding techniques.
Understanding of different deployment models for server-side software
Responsibilities As the Software Engineer you will:
Have a good understanding at a general level of the technical stack and how aspects of the solution work together to realise overall objective.
Proactive use of test and deployment automation to assure quality of delivered software
An understanding of secure computing (OWASP top 10 etc) and defensive coding techniques
Understanding of different deployment models for server-side software, e.g. on-premise vs cloud, server’s vs containers
Be engaging with product managers and wider stakeholders to ensure developing things of value for customers and business
Proactive attitude towards the design and implementation of computer systems (desktop or preferably web applications) and the necessary learning required to realize a testable implementation
Consistent use of good Coding Standards and driven to improve personal code quality as well as a willingness and practice of embedding the standards with more junior developers.
Ability to use their knowledge to help implement the technical direction of solutions to moderately complex technical problems.
Drive to achieve a high level of competency and ability across a varied technical toolset, in accordance with the systems in use.
Demonstrable experience of applied SOLID and refactoring
Working with us
We are an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to help you succeed. Here, you will find a collaborative, innovative and fun environment, where everyone has a part to play. Regardless of the team you join, we will surround you with co-workers who are passionate about what they do, and how they do it.
Working for you
We want to protect your health and help you accumulate wealth and secure your future.
We are therefore delighted to offer:
25 day holiday allowance with the option to buy additional days
Access to a competitive contributory pension scheme and life assurance
2 days community responsibility days
Health screening and private medical benefits
Season ticket loan
About LexisNexis
We’re a superb company to work for, with great people, world class technology, market leading products, a culture of innovation and collaboration, and superb career prospects.
At LexisNexis, we believe in the power of data and advanced analytics for better risk management. With over 40 years of expertise, we are the trusted data analytics provider for organizations seeking actionable insights to manage risks and improve results while upholding the highest standards for security and privacy.
LexisNexis serves customers in more than 100 countries and is part of FTS 100, RELX Group plc, a world-leading provider of information and analytics for professional and business customers across industries.
Reference ID: R20380
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: £1.00-£2.00 per year
Benefits:
Company pension
Life insurance
Private medical insurance
Schedule:
Monday to Friday

Title: Software Engineer
Job description:
Beginner level ability in software development, such coding assignments.
Debug basic software components and identify code defects for remediation.
full-description:
You won’t just keep up, you’ll break new ground.

At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. When you join #TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day.

As part of our diverse tech team, you can architect, code and ship software that makes us an essential part of our customers’ digital lives. Here, you can work alongside talented engineers in an open, supportive, inclusive environment where your voice is valued, and you make your own decisions on what tech to use to solve challenging problems. Amex offers a range of opportunities to work with the latest technologies and encourages you to back the broader engineering community through open source. And because we understand the importance of keeping your skills fresh and relevant, we give you dedicated time to invest in your professional development. Find your place in technology on #TeamAmex

As an Engineer I, you will design, develop, solves problems, debug, evaluate, modify, deploy, and document software and systems that meet the needs of customer-facing applications, business applications, and/or internal end user applications. You will be a member of a product engineering or delivery and integration team reporting to a Senior Engineer, Engineering Director or Director Product Delivery & Integration.

How will you make an impact in this role?

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Job description:
Is empathetic and good with people, able to manage stakeholders and mentor other engineers.
We can even make sellers chain-free, with our cash advance securing…
full-description:
Nested is redefining estate agency in the UK. With a combination of groundbreaking technology, innovative finance and expert local agents, Nested is fixing the whole moving experience one problem at a time.
We're a modern agent built for movers, the first estate agent to support both the selling and buying process with everything in between. We can even make sellers chain-free, with our cash advance securing their ideal home before they sell.
We are a wildly ambitious team, backed by Europe’s leading VCs and led by an experienced, hands-on founding team. We're all contributing remotely to build a new era for home movers, with plans to optionally work from home 3 days of the week in the future when we can spend some time in our Farringdon office again. And when work is over, there’s plenty of socialising, from film nights to sports days.
If redefining an entire industry is a challenge that motivates you, come and join the team at Nested.
The product team:
Our team's mission is to create the best tools in the industry. We break that down into two pillars:
We want to build the best customer account for home sellers on Android and iPhone and web, providing visibility into what is traditionally a low-trust, emotionally fraught process and delightful flows to remove friction like constant phone calls.
We want to build the best agency platform: one that gives Nested agents superpowers and allows them to focus on what matters most - providing fantastic customer service.
Requirements:
We are looking for someone who:
Likes to get things done, that merge button is so satisfying.
Is motivated by a great product that makes a difference, solving problems for people through technology.
Is empathetic and good with people, able to manage stakeholders and mentor other engineers.
Is keen to learn.
May have an interest in either management or in being a technical expert one day.
They will:
Spend time with our product managers figuring out what our next great product feature will be.
Deliver features end-to-end, including what to measure, what v1 looks like and what success looks like. We use a process called feature leading to do that.
Use, or learn to use, our tech stack, Elixir, GraphQL and React. We are language agnostic in our hiring. We like to optimise for simplicity, and write code for the next engineer.
Help improve our diversity by contributing to workshops we run. We teach elixir to various groups.
Work at and learn to run a startup. We’ve already helped a few folks chase their own dreams!
On a day-to-day basis they could be:
Having business impact - by leading and contributing to new features as part of a cross-functional team, pairing with other engineers where it makes sense.
Having technical impact - by ensuring our tech estate is not a blocker to our business goals and engaging with cross-team architectural decisions.
Having an impact on your team - by coaching, mentoring, teaching, helping to break down tasks into small manageable chunks, reviewing others’ code, and make sure we’re giving and receiving feedback regularly.
Helping to improve our teams' well-being - for example by organising a social or two.
Helping to improve our brand - for example by blogging, running a work experience day for local school children or mentoring an intern for a few months.
Benefits:
Salary between £70k and £90k per annum based on experience.
Generous options grant with further options awarded at reviews depending on performance.
4% employer pension contribution.
Private health insurance with gym discounts & more.
27 days holiday + bank holidays.
Work From Home 3 days a week, and flexible working hours. (though we are fully remote right now)
£1,000 personal development budget per year.
Generous maternity package, 16 weeks full pay.
Generous paternity package, 4 weeks paternity leave.
Should these packages not suit you, we are happy to discuss alternatives.
Monthly team social events.
Plus, if you’re ever buying or selling a home, we're pretty good at that as well and employees get it at a discount.
Interview process:
Stage 1: A chat with one of our engineering team, where we get to learn more about one another and see if the role is a good fit for both parties.
Stage 2: A live coding session with one of the engineers in the team you'd work in. Partly in a language of your choice, partly in Elixir (we'll send you some learning materials ahead of time so you only have to learn a subset of the language). All on your machine in your most comfortable coding environment. We want to see how you learn and how you perform when comfortable.
Stage 3: Two culture & values fit interviews with Matthew our Head of Product and one other.
We are striving to build a diverse and inclusive team, but we recognise there is always more to be done. In the last year, we’ve focused on running workshops in collaboration with tech bootcamps, promoting self-education through our anti-racism reading list (among other reading lists), sponsoring work visas and building diversity into the engineering growth framework. If you would like to talk to us about these efforts, or have suggestions for how we can do better, we would love to hear from you.
Nested is proud to be an equal opportunities employer: At Nested we embrace diversity and see it as a benefit to our company. That's why we're committed to hiring top talent regardless of race, religion, colour, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age or status as an individual with a disability.
We’re a growing team and happy to make any accommodations we can for individual needs. If you have an additional accessibility or other requirement we haven’t considered, we will do our best to adapt and make sure your needs are met.
Nested GDPR Compliance - Please take 2 minutes to read our Nested Privacy Notice for Recruitment and learn how we will process your data.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: £70,000.00-£90,000.00 per year

JPMC's Finance Technology department designs, develops and maintains a series of applications related to financial reporting, internal controls and regulatory calculation/reporting.

Experience with Test Driven Development in building scalable and flexible software frameworks, platforms and API's
Finance industry experience would be desirable

Close partnership with the software development team globally.
The global QTrade Rates team have a strong and successful history of managing and nurturing…
full-description:
The QTrade Rates application stack integrates with our internal pricing libraries produced by JPMorgan's Quantitative Research group and the bank's internal market data systems to allow the Global Non-linear Rates Sales and Trading desks to quickly and simply structure trades; compute, view, summarise and report the risk for these trades; share in-process trades between the different groups involved in trade execution; and provide a single point of trade capture into the downstream prime record systems.

Full stack software engineer - core Java (Spring, Swing, SWT), Python, UNIX, Linux, Windows, SQL, Jenkins, Eclipse / IntelliJ IDE.
Structured derivatives products, pricing, risk across any of Rates, FX or Equities trading

full-description:
As a Senior Software Engineering (Vice President), your mission is to help lead our team of innovators and technologists toward creating next-level solutions that improve the way our business is run. Your deep knowledge of design, analytics, development, coding, testing and application programming will help your team raise their game, meeting your standards, as well as satisfying both business and functional requirements. Title: Intern - Software Developer
Job description: You will be helping Pearson create and maintain software systems that support he the production of digital learning content utilizing modernized, team-oriented…
full-description:
Software Development Intern
Why join Pearson’s intern program?
Pearson is the world’s learning company. We help people of all ages acquire the knowledge and skills they need to be successful in their work and careers. We believe that everyone should be able to keep learning, every day and in every way, throughout their lives. Bringing together everything we know about the science of learning and the latest technology; we’re shaping the future of teaching and learning.
We’re looking for the next generation of talented undergraduates to join our team for an unforgettable 12-week internship. An internship at Pearson is an opportunity to bring your own unique perspective as a learner, together with your academic knowledge, technical skills, and enthusiasm, to help create products used by students like you.
As one of our interns, you will gain a comprehensive introduction to our business. You’ll be assigned to a team and work on real-life projects that bring our products and services to life. On the job training and professional development will be provided to enable you to contribute to the business. You’ll also have direct access to a senior member of the team, as each intern will be mentored to help you make the most of the 12-week program.
We foster a work environment that’s inclusive as well as diverse, where our people can be themselves. Every idea and perspective are valued so that our products reflect the people we serve — our teachers and learners.
What Does the Internship Program Offer?
Successful candidates will spend 12 weeks working with our technology teams.
You will be paid for the duration of your internship. The internship begins on Monday, June 6th and ends Friday, August 26th.
Job Description
As a Software Developer, you will develop expertise in software engineering practices, working collaboratively with the development teams within the Content Program. You will be helping Pearson create and maintain software systems that support he the production of digital learning content utilizing modernized, team-oriented software development tools and practices. This consist of Modern UX designs, Microservice Architectures and Assessment Services.
What does the 12 weeks involve?
Interns will develop a broad knowledge of Software Development Process within the Content Program at Pearson, working with teams developing, configuring, and testing systems and tools utilizing a variety of technologies.
Minimum Requirements
We look for Students pursuing a STEM degree (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) with software development or relevant work experience. We also look for Students pursuing a degree in computer science, cyber security, software engineering, information security, engineering, or technology.
Students should also have a basic understanding of Cloud platforms, in particular AWS, Azure and/or Google. Experience in coding with Python or similar would be useful.
Students should be a ‘people person’, well-rounded and happy to take on new challenges.
A desire to learn and accept new challenges is important.
Graduation date between December 2022 and May 2024 and should be able to travel to one of our office locations.
Job: PROJECT/TEMPORARY WORKFORCE
Organization: Technology & Operations
Schedule: FULL_TIME
Req ID: 581

Title: UI React Engineer - Applied AI
Job description:
Experience with designing and developing software, and best development practices.
Extensive with designing and developing software, and best development…
full-description:
Grade: 601, 602 or 603
Hiring manager: Location dependent
Location: London
UI Engineer/Applied AI- Associate, Senior Associate or Vice President
About our Team
The mission of our Applied AI team is to ensure J.P. Morgan's Global Technology Infrastructure can readily capitalize on the latest AI capabilities, without limitations to scale and complexity. In doing so, the team builds software systems, AI models, technological process and intelligent frameworks that minimize technological risk, while increasing operational efficiency and efficacy across the lines of business.
To achieve this, our team has assembled a diverse range of first-class talent, spanning three specialist pillars of Data Scientists, Engineers and Product leads. Across these pillars, our people work collaboratively, engaging with a broad range of stakeholders and partners to accelerate the adoption and delivery of AI-optimized infrastructure across the firm.
Our team has three core hubs of Jersey City, London and Buenos Aires, and is underpinned by a superb culture. As we have scaled from our "startup" roots inside a corporation, we have learned to place a premium on four values as a team: Open collaboration, Always learning, Ethical expertise and Practical innovation. This all makes for an exceptionally friendly, supportive, creative, dynamic, and ultimately impactful environment.
Who are we looking for?
As we continue to grow, we are looking to hire talented engineers, across a broad range of experience, who share our passion for delivering impactful AI solutions at enterprise scale. We want people who get excited working with cutting edge technologies and methodologies, such as hybrid cloud architectures, latest web frameworks and superb user experience. So, if you are looking at taking your career to the next stage, see if you have the criteria we are looking for:
Junior Positions:

Experience with designing and developing software, and best development practices
Basic understanding of computer science fundamentals (data structures, algorithms, optimization) and Software Engineering (OOP, design, architecture, etc.)
Good understanding of both Javascript basics and the modern Javascript (ES6+), HTML5, CSS3
Good understanding of React and its most recent versions (v16, v17)
Basic understanding of Unit Testing, especially in React environment (Jest, React Testing Library)

Mid-level Positions:
Extensive with designing and developing software, and best development practices
Solid understanding of computer science fundamentals (data structures, algorithms, optimization) and Software Engineering (OOP, design, architecture, etc.)
Deep understanding of both Javascript basics and the modern Javascript (ES6+), HTML5, CSS3
Deep understanding of React and its most recent versions (v16, v17)
Experience with Typescript (v3+)
Good understanding of Unit Testing, especially in React environment (Jest, React Testing Library)

Senior positions:
All of the above
Superb communicator
Experience leading front-end projects/teams.

What will your responsibilities be?
As an engineer, you can expect the following responsibilities to form your core book of work:

Building front-end of a greenfield AI Platform.
Contributing to the design, architecture, build and deployment of the solution
Collaborating with data scientists, product managers and external technical and business teams.

In addition to this, everyone on our team is encouraged to participate in three other sets of activities, which we find helps our team members contribute and grow:
Corporate citizenship: supporting communities of practice or Business Resilience Groups (and across our team we have people representing all manner of diversity, equity and inclusion groups).
Learning and development: everyone needs time and space to grow, and managers will help you set aside time for this - so you can benefit from the huge amount of internal resources and learning programs available to you.
Consultancy: we want you to be experts in your specialist field, and if you are ready, we will encourage you to engage with internal clients, speak at our tech events and represent us at external conferences.

What other benefits are there?
While J.P. Morgan provides extensive benefits to all employees, our own team also has crowd-sourced culture leads who contribute to the cohesion and togetherness of our team, arranging social activities and engagement events for those who want to participate.
What else do we want you to let you know?

Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.

Title: Software Engineer, C++/Boost and Software Defined Storage
Job description:
Experience of the Linux and free software world.
Experience writing and maintaining software in C++ using Boost libraries.
full-description:
We’re building a different kind of IT company, one that meets our customers and our own team on their turf, on their terms. We’re growing fast right now and you can be part of it with all the opportunities to add value that come with that. Curious? Great! That’s what we like in a Softie!
Our Softies are a diverse and globally distributed team that are on a mission to change the future of data infrastructure with task-specific hardware and open source. We aim to do all the hard work so that our customers can adopt the best open source has to offer in a bulletproof and resilient way. Our team thinks differently, working as an integrated but globally dispersed team of experts in hardware manufacturing, firmware, software, infrastructure and everything in between.

As we grow our operations, we're looking to grow our team who contribute solutions to the open source community.

Responsibilities include:
Develop high-quality, extensible and reusable software, primarily in C++ or Python.
Interact with internal engineering and the Ceph community to resolve problems and define new features.
Display strong technical leadership in feature definition, feature delivery, code review, and backlog management.
Develop and maintain software for delivery, operations and life-cycle management of Ceph storage.

Skills & Experience
Essential
5+ years Python programming language experience.
5+ years professional software delivery using Go, C, C++, Java or similar.
Experience writing and maintaining software in C++ using Boost libraries.
Experience with open source distributed storage such as Ceph, Gluster, Minio, or similar.
Experience of the Linux and free software world.
Excellent communications skills in the English language, both verbal and written, especially in online environments such as mailing lists and chat systems.
Ability to effectively interact with a diverse group of people (both technical and non-technical).
Ability to be productive in a globally distributed team through self-discipline and self-motivation, delivering according to a schedule, and to motivate and mentor others to do the same.

Desirable
Technical understanding of complex distributed systems.
Operational and/or development experience with Ceph.
Block and file subsystem experience within the Linux kernel.
Experience with storage performance analysis tools including fio, blktrace, perf, etc.
Delivery of scale-out service solutions.
Exposure to devops/system administration.
Experience working on a distributed team on an open source project.

Location
We operate globally and also have some pretty cool offices worldwide. Time travel (aka time zone optimization) is one of our super powers and we use this to our best advantage in setting up teams and how we work. To complement our existing teams, this role can be based remotely, or in one of our offices in the US, UK, Germany, Czech Republic, Australia, New Zealand or Singapore.

Benefits
We pay competitively in the market in which you want to be located, and provide an attractive benefits package including significant share options in our fast growing, mid-stage start-up.

Recruitment agencies
We work with like-minded companies across all of our business. We’re not into vendor lock-in of any type, we don’t do the hard sell and we treat time and attention as valuable resources. Recruitment agents, please don’t send us unsolicited resumes or CVs unless we’ve asked you to work with us on the role - it just shows us you’re not our type.

Title: Cloud Support Engineer
Job description: Building strong working relationships with key stakeholders across Application engineers, Site Reliability and Cloud Engineering, focused on fostering efficient…
full-description:
he public cloud team is responsible for engineering and operating the cloud infrastructure and platforms of JPMC ensuring reliability, resiliency, and security. We have a Cloud Support Engineer (CSE) position to help the JPMC Cloud team with production support in the public cloud. In this role, you'll be working with application engineers across the organization to provide white glove service, technical support, and executive level communications to our customers. You will support customers involved in time sensitive incidents and manage their overall experience by collaborating closely with cloud platform users.
In this role, your responsibilities include:

Assisting customers in troubleshooting cloud services, provide clear information to clients on product feature, functionality and best practices.
Always be the first contact for internal cloud platform users. Your technical acumen and customer-facing skills will enable you to effectively represent the public cloud team.
Communicating client perspective to Product and Development teams for feature improvements/fixes.
Managing the lifecycle of an incident, acting as the single point of contact for the customer, impact analysis, internal stakeholder coordination and communication.
Building strong working relationships with key stakeholders across Application engineers, Site Reliability and Cloud Engineering, focused on fostering efficient collaboration and driving down resolution times.
Developing, implementing and coordinating key post escalation processes such as post incident reviews, post mortems, trend analysis and other key continuous improvement activities in conjunction with the Site reliability engineering team.
Establishing and maintaining best practices of incident response and site reliability in accordance with industry standards.
Monitoring, reporting and analysis of KPIs, SLAs and relevant operational data to ensure the best internal and customer experience.
Driving and managing incident review meetings focused on critical/major escalations with senior leadership.

Qualifications:
Strong technical aptitude and ability to become a product expert quickly
Quickly understand customer use cases and requirements
Demonstrating strong analytical, troubleshooting, and problem-solving expertise.
Proficient in Cloud Technologies, bonus points for AWS/Google Cloud certifications.
Ability to make timely decisions from both business and technical standpoints
Excellent verbal, written, communication and receptive listening skills.
Detail oriented, organized and have strong analytical skills, with a data-driven mindset
Respond to cases within SLA, with the appropriate level of urgency. Escalate issues to internal teams promptly when required. Familiarity with Servicenow/Jira will be a plus.
Create and curate reports and metrics for executive reviews.
Willingness to participate in weekend and holiday on-call rotation coverage

Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.
We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

Title: Software Developer Apprentice Level 6
Job description:
Monday - Friday 9am to 6pm with some flexibility and WFH ( work from home) on this if approved by your line manager.
We use low code (a.
full-description:
The responsibility of the software development team lies in the creation and development of the Genesis product for our clients, so you will be working on projects that contribute to our continued success. We have a team of over 75 here in London.

Closing date: 12 Feb 2022
Apprenticeship summary
Annual wage
£22,000.00
Working week
Monday - Friday 9am to 6pm with some flexibility and WFH ( work from home) on this if approved by your line manager.
Total hours per week: 40.00
Expected duration
3 years
Possible start date
28 Feb 2022
Date posted
16 Dec 2021
Distance
0.7 miles
Apprenticeship level
Higher
Level 4 (Higher national Certificate)
Reference number
VAC001802482
Positions
2 available
The responsibility of the software development team lies in the creation and development of
the Genesis product for our clients,
So you will be working on projects that contribute to our continued success.
We have a team of over 75 here in London, and we are lucky enough to
employ some of the very best developers, so it’s a great place to come and learn!
The Genesis software development apprenticeship scheme is targeted at individuals who
have a keen interest in programming and want to jump straight into a career in technology.
This program offers a unique opportunity to combine classroom and work-based learning.
Across the 3-year duration of this program, you’ll spend 20% of your time at Ada, the
National College for Digital Skills, and 80% at Genesis.
At Genesis you’ll be learning on the job, gaining extensive experience and training across many areas of the development lifecycle.
All the work experience you gain here, in addition to the content covered at the
college, will contribute towards a BSc Honours degree in Digital & Technology Solutions.
The key focus of this scheme is on your personal development, from essential technical and coding skills, to soft skills such as communication, teamwork, organisation and problem-solving.
Requirements and prospects
Desired skills


Innovative thinking and problem-solving – thinking differently when you encounter
problems and not being afraid to trial new ways of thinking.
Organisation and time- management – you can work under pressure to meet tight
deadlines whilst maintaining high work quality standards.
Proactive approach to work – you are a self-starter who embraces new challenges.
Communication (both verbal and written) – you are confident in building and
maintaining relationships with internal stakeholders.
Flexible and adaptable – you will likely be working across multiple projects across the
area of software development, so flexibility to move between different tasks is
essential.
Curiosity – you constantly strive to learn and further develop your knowledge and
skills.
Feedback – you embrace feedback from others, and actively work to improve your
areas for development.
Teamwork – you work and contribute effectively within team situations.
Personal qualities
Flexible and adaptable – you will likely be working across multiple projects across the
area of software development, so flexibility to move between different tasks is
essential.
Curiosity – you constantly strive to learn and further develop your knowledge and
skills.
Feedback – you embrace feedback from others, and actively work to improve your
areas for development.
Desired qualifications
In this scheme, we are more interested in your approach to situations and problems related
to the competency skills listed above, than purely your academic performance. We do
however, have minimum requirements for candidates’ academic qualifications which we
prefer candidates to hold as indicators of performance capabilities within the role:
Five GCSEs, with at least grade 4 (C) in English and Maths.
Level 3 qualification e.g. A-Level, BTEC or equivalent.
Some previous coding experience (or willingness to learn) – certified or self-taught.
Some previous general work experience is preferred.
An interest in and willingness to learn about what we do.
Future prospects
Upon successful completion of the apprenticeship, there may be an opportunity to train further or a permanent position may be on offer.
Things to consider
Benefits & Package
We have partnered with the prestigious ADA, the National College for Digital Skills. We are
also proud to offer the following benefits:
Starting salary of £22,000 with regular reviews based on performance.
Pension and Private Healthcare Scheme.
Great corporate discounts via our ThanksBen Platform.
Yearly renewing budget allowances for WFH set-up, wellbeing, and additional
training.
Working hours are 9am to 6pm with some flexibility on this if approved by your line
manager.
About the employer
Genesis is a software development company with a difference. We use low code (a
development approach allowing clients to create software applications faster and without as
high-level programming knowledge) to sell our platform and applications to banks and other
financial institutions.
In the last year we have more than doubled in size, so it is an exciting time for us as we
continue on our growth journey. We are looking for talented people, who share our passions,
to join us. We combine the best of big company benefits with the ability to really make a
difference, and we strive to ensure that everyone has the opportunity to learn and grow.
We are excited to launch our first apprenticeship scheme to be based mainly at our central London Office
Employer
GENESIS GLOBAL TECHNOLOGY LIMITED
https://genesis.global/
Address
1-3
Dufferin Street
London
EC1Y 8NA
You must have JavaScript enabled to view a map of the location
Training
Training provider
Ada, National College for Digital Skills
Applications for this apprenticeship are being processed by Ada, National College for Digital Skills
Contact
Lavender T Brown 020 4536 7362 lavender@ada.ac.uk
Ada, National College for Digital Skills are the training provider for this apprenticeship. Our apprenticeship campus is based in Whitechapel. Ada is England’s first new Further Education College since 1993. Our mission is to work in collaboration with the industry to design and deliver a curriculum that empowers students to progress into highly skilled digital roles.
Our apprenticeship Level 6 leads to a BSc Digital and Technology Solutions Degree which is validated by the Open University. Each cohort spends their first 6 weeks at college taking part in our Launchpad training. This training not only covers modules for the degree programme but also ensures to prepare you for the workplace through team work, collaboration etc. Following the Launchpad training you will return to your employer for 6-7 weeks returning to Ada after that for one week blocks on a rotation basis.

Apprenticeship standard
Software developer

Level 4 (Higher national Certificate)

Title: Mid-level Frontend Software Engineer
Job description:
Passionate about software engineering and about delivering a quality product.
Acre is rebuilding the UK’s £1.4 trillion mortgage market from the ground up, with…
full-description:
Better homebuying for everyone involved
Acre is rebuilding the UK’s £1.4 trillion mortgage market from the ground up, with a completely new, end-to-end management system for mortgages.
Our platform cuts out the unnecessary admin, pain and friction from buying a home. We're covering the entire journey, from figuring out what you can borrow, to getting your keys. We're guided both by the voice of real home buyers and by our close relationships with brokers, lenders and insurers, through our exclusive broker distribution agreement representing over £40 billion in mortgage lending each year. We won’t stop until the process of buying, mortgaging, conveyancing, and ensuring your home is affordable and completely seamless.
The Role
We are looking for a mid-level engineer that wants to part of a fast growing startup that is transforming the way we buy homes.
Your role will be to work closely with the CTO and the broader team to help build out platform in a manner that is highly reliable, consistent and secure. You will be highly motivated, be technology agnostic, and be passionate and proud of the work you produce. Our team believes in user-centric product design, and you will be building an iconic, beautiful system unlike anything in the market today.
What you’ll be doing
You’ll be joining a team that is responsible for the design, implementation and testing of the user interfaces that empowers consumers, brokers and operational functions to efficiently manage the home buying process.
You will be expected to write reusable, tested and efficient code that is always production ready and to be responsible for the whole lifecycle of the components you build.
Who you will be:
Passionate about software engineering and about delivering a quality product.
Demonstrable experience in web development and user experience.
An understanding of React
Have a 2:1 or higher degree in Computer Science, Mathematics or other scientific discipline, or equivalent experience.
Experience of using automated testing platforms and unit tests.
An understanding of security and reliability concerns.
Experience of a range of languages, frameworks and patterns.
What we offer:
Chance to join a world-class team at a fully funded startup.
Competitive compensation package relative to experience.
25 days leave as standard.
Free accommodation for the first week for those relocating to London for the first time
Vibrant office in Central London with excellent coffee, snacks, and open happy hour
A wide range of virtual and in-person social activities, including annual Summer and Christmas parties.
Private healthcare, 4% pension contribution matching with no limits, and cycle to work scheme.
See our https://www.acresoftware.com/careers for more of what we offer
We’re looking for people that will get stuck in and make a difference. We have a great collaborative, entrepreneurial team that are passionate about what they do. If you want to join a team that is changing people’s lives for the better, then we’d love to hear from you.
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Frontend Developer
Job description:
Understanding of software design principles, including progressive enhancement.
Work within a Ruby on Rails based web stack and applying modern software…
full-description:
Location
London, Bristol, Manchester
Position type
Contractor / Interim
Summary
Frontend Developer - Contract/Interim - GDS/GOV.UK - 6 Month Contract
This is an opportunity to join Government Digital Service/GOV.UK on an interim basis.
We typically pay between £500 to £550 a day for Frontend Developer's via our contracting route, but rates can also be determined by the contract deliverables.
Overview
You’ll share the responsibility for the digital transformation of the government. You’ll ensure high quality code is delivered in line with programme goals and delivery cycles. You’ll thrive using agile methods and enjoy working openly, collaboratively and as part of a multidisciplinary team focused on one or more services. Above all, you’ll want to make the government better, which may sometimes involve challenging the status quo.
To learn more about what Frontend Developers do in government please review the DDaT Capability Framework.
JOB SPECIFICATION
Participate in a multi-disciplinary team that develops and iterates publishing features to meet the needs of citizens and government publishers.
Build, iterate and maintain user interfaces of GOV.UK web applications; apply modern best practices of accessibility
Work within a Ruby on Rails based web stack and applying modern software development techniques such as automated testing.
Share knowledge of tools and techniques with your wider team, both developers and non-developers
Key Skills Required
experience in frontend development, with detailed knowledge of HTML, CSS and JavaScript
experience with the Ruby on Rails framework and a reasonable understanding of the Ruby programming language
experience of working with content management systems (CMS) and a good understanding of popular CMS products
understanding of software design principles, including progressive enhancement
experience in building robust and accessible interfaces that work for as many users as possible, regardless of their needs
ability to quickly research and new programming tools and techniques
a systematic approach to solving problems
experience of using testing to validate solutions
understanding of agile environments and version control
basic understanding about web security
an awareness of technologies used for web applications, e.g. HTTPS, JSON and CDNs, and of Unix-like operating systems e.g. Linux and/or Mac OS
Closing date for applications
29 December 2021
Who we are
At the Government Digital Service (GDS), our mission is to build a simple, joined-up and personalised experience of government for everyone. Using our unique position at the centre of government, we develop services that work for the user, however complex the underlying systems may be. We believe that ensuring things work for end users is the only way to realise the efficiencies that come with digital transformation.
Our focus is on delivering five missions in the following areas:
GOV.UK as the single and trusted online destination for government information and services
Joined-up services that solve whole problems and span multiple departments
A simple digital identity solution that works for everyone
Common tools and expert services
Joined-up data across departments
You can read more about these missions and our vision for the transformation of government in our 2021-2024 strategy
Things you need to know
You can find out about the application process and practical details like our office locations on the things you need to know page.
Equal Opportunities
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our organisation. You can find out more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion and read our equal opportunities statement on our Diversity and Inclusion page.

We currently have an opportunity for a Cloud Automation Engineer

The Global Cloud Platform Services Service Transition team is a global team with a broad range of deep technical and
organisational skills and are involved in delivering operational efficiencies
through automation, analytics and process improvements for the wider Cloud and
Server Build and Operations teams. We require a deeply technical
and experienced software engineer to focus on VMWare SDDC technologies to

Title: Intern .net Developer - Placement Year
Job description: The department at Mountain Warehouse is split into many small teams responsible for the applications relevant to an area of the business (i.e. product-focussed…
full-description:
Overview
Mountain Warehouse is a profitable and privately-owned business. The development department is focussed on getting things done rather than predicting when things will get done. What does this mean? It means that:
Exciting changes in the business can appear at short notice.
If we need something and it’s reasonably-priced, we can usually just get it.
You can suggest ideas that can change the business.
We’re light on meetings!
The department at Mountain Warehouse is split into many small teams responsible for the applications relevant to an area of the business (i.e. product-focussed teams). We work to improve the eCommerce offering internationally, to improve our tools & processes for buying, merchandising, retail operations, logistics, customer service, finance, etc…
Development process
At Mountain Warehouse we believe that developers should be connected to the things that they build – as such, developers get to spend time with the business owners on a regular basis and specifications are built iteratively based upon feedback. We take the time to get things right rather than rushing on to the next thing. All code is peer reviewed and TDD is promoted as much as possible.
A selection of the technologies we use
C# (.net Core and .net Framework)
TypeScript / JavaScript
SQL Server
RabbitMQ / MassTransit
Entity Framework
Microservices architecture
MongoDB
React
RESTful APIs
Azure
Jenkins / Continuous Delivery
Docker
Some teams are mostly considered “backend” but most teams are working as full-stack. As such, we would expect you to have exposure to a modern typed language (C#, Java, TypeScript) and ideally JavaScript.
Support You Will Receive
We are putting together a training pathway for all new junior starters – so expect your first few months to involve a lot of internal & external workshops and a decent amount of study time. We trust this will quickly give you the knowledge you need to be working on our production systems.
You will experience working in at least two different teams while at Mountain Warehouse and will have someone to mentor you on a daily basis during that time. Over the course of the whole year you will also get regular check-ins from the dedicated YINI Lead.
Office & Culture
Our IT department is based in a modern office building over the road from the rest of the company, it’s a stone’s throw from Victoria which gives you easy transport links to Clapham High St, Soho, Camden, Brixton, Shoreditch, Notting Hill, etc. All the team is constantly learning, and we have a dedicated day every month for training – we also have regular lunch’n’learn events and twice-yearly hack events.
We have recently changed so that the team is a mix of remote and on-site developers. We think you will get the most out of working in our office (after Coronavirus), but it is not a requirement and any team events will be conducted in a remote-first way.
The team is sociable and we fully expect that atmosphere to return when we are once again back in the office.
What’s in it for you?
Competitive salary and benefits package
Holiday allowance
50% staff discount & 25% for family and friends
Pension scheme
In 1997, we launched Mountain Warehouse to make the outdoors accessible to everyone by offering value for money product and exemplary customer service.
The outdoor industry had become very jargon heavy and we wanted to create a brand that would cater to our mothers and our neighbour’s kids as well as seasoned professionals who understood the technology.
Our expansion since then has seen the brand grow and the product evolve, but the small family business that makes MW special has remained. Great product is at the heart of everything we do.
As we expand internationally we employ a team of dedicated diverse people to offer our valued customers the best possible experience when visiting our stores, shopping online and putting our range through its paces.
Welcome to our journey.

Please ensure that when applying you submit a portfolio. This should consist of any previous code that you have worked on (previous side project, university project or a collection of code)
Any applications with no portfolio, will sadly not be considered.
